item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: That's awesome information! I will be sure to keep an eye out for them!
item.content:encoded: That’s awesome information! I will be sure to keep an eye out for them!

item.title: By: Satoru Inoue
item.dc:creator: Satoru Inoue
item.description: Re: pros on GoQuest. Ohashi Hirofumi 6p is the top player in 9x9 and 13x13 at the moment (spaceman). I know this from reading his Twitter feed (in Japanese): https://twitter.com/ohashihirofumi He's a well-known problem maker, so it makes sense that he does well on small boards w/ lots of life & death situations. His 13x13 games often involve interesting openings like 5-7. I think spaceman is a nickname he has from playing weird openings on 19x19. Mannami Nao 3p also talks about GoQuest on Twitter: https://twitter.com/naonao_myu And it's pretty clear that her account is naonaonao. kuronekoking was #1 on 13x13 for a while, and there are rumors that this is Cho U 9p. Circumstantial evidence for this: Cho U made a 4x4 Go puzzle game called "kuroneko no yonro" ('black cat's 4x4'). There are other pros who have tweeted about playing GoQuest, so I suspect there are quite a few of them near the top of the rankings. The top players are at worst "nearly pro," and I think it's worthwhile sometimes to watch their games.
item.content:encoded:
Re: pros on GoQuest. Ohashi Hirofumi 6p is the top player in 9×9 and 13×13 at the moment (spaceman). I know this from reading his Twitter feed (in Japanese): https://twitter.com/ohashihirofumi
He’s a well-known problem maker, so it makes sense that he does well on small boards w/ lots of life & death situations. His 13×13 games often involve interesting openings like 5-7. I think spaceman is a nickname he has from playing weird openings on 19×19.
Mannami Nao 3p also talks about GoQuest on Twitter: https://twitter.com/naonao_myu
And it’s pretty clear that her account is naonaonao.
kuronekoking was #1 on 13×13 for a while, and there are rumors that this is Cho U 9p. Circumstantial evidence for this: Cho U made a 4×4 Go puzzle game called “kuroneko no yonro” (‘black cat’s 4×4’).
There are other pros who have tweeted about playing GoQuest, so I suspect there are quite a few of them near the top of the rankings. The top players are at worst “nearly pro,” and I think it’s worthwhile sometimes to watch their games.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Yeah. The extra life thing is kind of weird. It seems like maybe they limit the number of games you can play a day? I don't play even close to that much each day, so I wouldn't know if there's an actual limit. In terms of the interface though, I think it would be better if they allowed you to confirm your move since I've made a couple of misclicks along the way. Otherwise though, solid app considering it's free.
item.content:encoded:
Yeah. The extra life thing is kind of weird. It seems like maybe they limit the number of games you can play a day? I don’t play even close to that much each day, so I wouldn’t know if there’s an actual limit.
In terms of the interface though, I think it would be better if they allowed you to confirm your move since I’ve made a couple of misclicks along the way. Otherwise though, solid app considering it’s free.

item.title: By: Buck Rudder
item.dc:creator: Buck Rudder
item.description: I discover GoQuest last week and it's a must for playing quick games on phone. Interface is perfect except about the invitation code that I don't understand the meaning (getting extra life ?)
item.content:encoded: I discover GoQuest last week and it’s a must for playing quick games on phone. Interface is perfect except about the invitation code that I don’t understand the meaning (getting extra life ?)

item.title: By: Weekly Progress Report: #03 - BenGoZen
item.dc:creator: Weekly Progress Report: #03 - BenGoZen
item.description: […] Three weeks and count­ing! I am feel­ing like I am start­ing to make some real progress as I con­tinue to adhere to my train­ing reg­i­men. Though I thought about upping my prob­lem solv­ing reg­i­men, I think it’s at a good place where I am mak­ing decent progress while the task is rel­a­tively easy to accom­plish. And as you’ll notice, I also added a play­ing reg­i­men as well which is very eas­ily sup­ported via the GoQuest app I talked about in my jour­nal entry ear­lier this week. […]
item.content:encoded: […] Three weeks and count­ing! I am feel­ing like I am start­ing to make some real progress as I con­tinue to adhere to my train­ing reg­i­men. Though I thought about upping my prob­lem solv­ing reg­i­men, I think it’s at a good place where I am mak­ing decent progress while the task is rel­a­tively easy to accom­plish. And as you’ll notice, I also added a play­ing reg­i­men as well which is very eas­ily sup­ported via the GoQuest app I talked about in my jour­nal entry ear­lier this week. […]
